metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12301 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Percona Server 5.6.44-85.0-1 packages for Debian and Ubuntu suffered anissue where the server would reset the root password to a blank value uponan upgrade. This was fixed in 5.6.44-85.0-2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12301` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

percona-server-server - 5.6.22-rel71.0-0ubuntu4
percona-server-server-5.6 - 5.6.22-rel71.0-0ubuntu4
percona-server-source-5.6 - 5.6.22-rel71.0-0ubuntu4
percona-server-test - 5.6.22-rel71.0-0ubuntu4
percona-server-test-5.6 - 5.6.22-rel71.0-0ubuntu4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: percona-server-5.6 package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.6.22-rel71.0-0ubuntu4').
